metadata.Title: CVE-2020-12404 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: For native-to-JS bridging the app requires a unique token to be passed that ensures non-app code can't call the bridging functions. That token could leak when used for downloading files. This vulnerability affects Firefox for iOS < 26.

notes.Note: alexmurray> This only affects Firefox for iOS, Firefox in Ubuntu is not affected by this vulnerability. tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
